Data Science.title: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow
Data Science.author: Aurelion Geron
Data Science.impact: In my opinion, this book is the most comprehensive single resource to learn Machine Learning

Data Science.title: Deep Learning Illustrated
Data Science.author: Jon Krohn
impact: Jon is a walking inspiration. He is an outstanding teacher. Simply explaining complex
terms seems natural to him. He knows how to touch the surface to give a big picture. But it's only
possible because he has a deep understanding of the topics that he teaches. A must-read book if you're into deep learning.

Data Science.title: Approaching (Almost) Any Machine Learning Problem
Data Science.author: Abhishek Thakur
Data Science.impact: Very Hands-On. Abhishek's fluency is out of any scale. You should check out his YouTube channel

Personal Growth.title: Seven Habits of Highly Effective People
Personal Growth.author: Stephen R. Covey
Personal Growth.impact: Personal #1. The book helped me redefining Independence. I learned the word "proactive" which became a life-changer.
topQuotes: We see the world, not as it is, but as we are â”€ or, as we are conditioned to see it.
If I really want to improve my situation, I can work on the one thing over which I have control - myself.
Happiness, like unhappiness, is a proactive choice.

Personal Growth.title: How to Win Friends & Influence People
Personal Growth.author: Dale Carnegie
impact: Personal #1. Made me realize my life far from an independent one. I learned the word "proactive" which became a life-changer.
Thanks to the book
topQuotes: To be interesting, be interested.
Only knowledge that is used sticks in your mind.
There is only one way to get the best of an argument -- and that is to avoid it.

Personal Growth.title: How Will You Measure Your Life?
Personal Growth.author: Clayton M. Christensen
impact: I realized my work was only a source of income. I felt unhappy, unfulfilled. There wasn't any personal meaning in the tasks I did.
My job stole the time and energy. I desired to quit. ASAP. I'm not talking about changing jobs. It's about becoming unemployed.
However, it's never easy. I didn't want to be a quitter. What will people think?
What about future interviews? How do I get away with such a decision?
topQuotes: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
The opposite of job dissatisfaction isn't job satisfaction, but rather an absence of job dissatisfaction.
Better sallaries. A more prestigious title. A nicer office They are, after all, what our friends and family see as signs, that we have "made it" professionally.

Personal Growth.title: You Are a Badass
Personal Growth.author: Jen Sincero
impact: Awesome book. I love it. Almost every single page contains a gem. It can be either a sentence, or a quote, or a whole passage.
I'm limited to five quotations per book. For this book, I could write at least fifty that made me stop and think.
When I started reading the book, I thought it wasn't about me. I thought I was "over it."
I thought: "What a great book for people who want to change their lives but don't know where to start. But I'm not there anymore.
I'm already in the process." I thought I knew the stuff.
This book made me realize how wrong I was. I didn't know the crap about being a badass. I still don't.
I still shit my pants when things get uncomfortable. Making decent money is another difficulty for me.
topQuotes: Our thoughts are the most powerful tools we've got.
Comparision is the fastest way to take all the fun out of life
Do not waste your precious time giving one single crap about what anybody else thinks of you.
What other people think about you has nothing to do with you and everything to do with them.

Financial Literacy.title: The Psychology of Money
Financial Literacy.author: Morhan Housel
description: Do you know what is the difference between a rich and a wealthy person? I do!
A must-read in the world of capitalism.
impact: I read this book in the Summer 2021. At the time, I was escaping the 9-5. It resonated with me at a high level.
Saving money is crucial. Save money to buy freedom. Save money to take control over your time.
Doing what you want, when you want it, with people you want is one of the biggests assets one can have in the modern world.
topQuotes: Controlling your time is the highest divident money pays.
Wealth is what you don't see.
Spending money to show people how much money you have is the fastest way to have less money.
Modern capitalism is a pro at two things: generating wealth and generating envy.
Money's greatest intrinsic value - and this can't be overstatet - is its ability to give you control over your time.
Someone driving a $100,000 car might be wealthy. But the only data point you have about their wealth they have $100,000 less than they did before they bought the car.

Financial Literacy.title: The Intelligent Investor
Financial Literacy.author: Benjamin Graham
impact: In the beginning of 2020, I started educating myself about finance. It is the first book about money I bought.
While reading I realized I wanted to be a passive investor. Since I want to do this long-term, I should invest in index funds.
And this is what I ended up doing.
topQuotes: Poeple who invest make money for themselves; people who speculate make money for their brokers.
The intelligent investor is the realist who sells to optimists and buys from pessimists.
While enthusiasm may be necessary for great accomplishments elsewhere, on Wall Street it almost invariably leads to disaster.
